I liked The Trip to Spain but it’s my least favourite of the trilogy. Coogan and Brydon are always fun to watch but the stories/characters seem to be getting more melancholic.not that there’s anything wrong with that. Maybe the premise is just getting tired.

My nine-year-old son and I watched @pennjillette and @MrTeller on #FoolUs and then afterwards he hid the Apple TV remote for 20 minutes while I tore couch/living room apart before he “revealed” it from side-pocket of his sweatpants. “Did I fool you?” he asked. Kids are magical.

@Planta Yeah, I’ve done about 8-10 prints over last couple of years. Always pleased.

@Planta Yes, and there’s a bit of deception going on because the white border and black “matte” is actually part of the print, so I don’t have to shell out $ for custom framing. Though each print is about $50. I get my stuff done at the Lab on West 2nd. They do great work.
@Planta Yes! I have one for each member of the family set in the mountains.

@thomsonjennifer I lost a follower since I tweeted that. I'm assuming it's because they don't want to hear about my problems.
For example, the baby is sick and has diarrhea; my son is getting a bit mouthy and I’m not sure my boots go with my skinny jeans, which are now torn thanks to a stray big toe.
It’s weird having to deal with a one-year-old’s problems, as well as a nine-year-old’s problems, and of course my 47-year-old problems. It’s a broad spectrum of issues.
Things you learn with a baby: poop can defy gravity.
